description: What can you add to a healthy plant-based sandwich that tastes good? How can tacos be ready in under 15 minutes? Learn all the possible ways to put delicious handheld meals together that will reflect your favorite flavors in a hurry.
Learn a variety of Ethiopian lentil dishes. Create delicious and hearty lentil stews and simmering lentil recipes with veggies using authentic Ethiopian spices.

Slow down and improve how you connect with yourself and others through the power of horses. Experience meditation with these generous and brave animals. Through breathing exercises and mindfulness practice with the horses, you'll learn the importance of self-awareness and living in the present moment.

Explore aspects of singing, from physical action through aesthetic experience, in a group setting. Choose your own songs and investigate breathing, tone production, diction and interpretation while you develop confidence and expressivity.

class_name: From Film to Real Life? UFOs, UAPs, Government and the Media
description: UFOs are real, according to the Pentagon. We will examine the congressional interest in UFOs, whistleblower accounts referencing a secret UFO crash retrieval program and how science fiction and media coverage shape our understanding of the topic.

class_name: The Face in the Forest: Meeting the Green Man
description: His leaf-covered face gazes silently from medieval churches and modern office buildings. Often called the "Green Man" this curious image has endured throughout centuries of art and architecture. Learn more about what is often viewed as an archetype of our human oneness with the earth.

class_name: Beatles Virtual Jam for All: Play and Sing Along
description: Play and sing your favorite Beatles songs with a group. Learn new chords. All acoustic instruments and voices welcome. You will hear and sing along only with the instructor, and you’ll see your classmates doing the same.
Master the miniature culinary art of crafting adorable, hyper-realistic foods perfect for viral posts. Tiny tacos, mini muffins, and bite-sized burgers—edible art at its cutest.

class_name: Introduction to Pirate Lingo and Sea Shanties
description: Embrace your inner buccaneer. Learn classic sea shanties, pirate vocabulary, and how to spin yarns that would make Blackbeard proud.

class_name: Speed Friendship: How to Make Friends as an Adult
description: Like speed dating—but for friendship. Develop quick conversational skills, practice ice-breakers, and find your new best friend in under five minutes.
Combine woodworking, engineering, and history to build and launch your own miniature siege engines. Great for science lovers and history buffs alike.

class_name: Beginner’s Guide to Reading Tea Leaves
description: Entertain your friends by interpreting tea-leaf patterns. Includes symbolic meanings, storytelling techniques, and the basics of hosting a tea-reading gathering.
Learn plant care as therapy. Understand how gardening boosts mood, practice meditative plant-watering, and adopt a plant companion to enhance well-being.
Create detailed maps for fictional stories or tabletop games. Includes geographic design, fictional culture placement, and realistic map-drawing techniques.

Pickleball is the fastest growing sport in America. A combination of ping pong, tennis and badminton that is enjoyed by all ages and skill levels. This fun, social and friendly game is easy to learn but can develop into a quick, fast-paced game for experienced players. Enroll to join the pickleball movement!
Master the art of competitive food consumption. Learn techniques for maximizing intake, speed, and digestive capacity. Explore various food challenges, from hot dogs to pies.

class_name: Banish Writer's Block: A Class for Writers Stuck in a Rut
description: Move past your writer's block or fear of sharing. Stretch the boundaries of your comfort zone with timed writing sessions, a variety of prompts (including phrases, objects, and memory work) and in-class sharing. All levels welcome.

class_name: Procrastination Mastery: Putting Things Off Until Later
description: Learn advanced techniques for delaying tasks, avoiding responsibilities, and embracing the art of 'mañana.' Includes workshops on excuse-making, distraction maximization, and guilt-free napping. Start date may be postponed.

Wheel-throw ceramic ware forms that accentuate surface area and are suited for the effects of soda firing. Utilize specially-formulated glazes. Participate in loading, wadding, firing, and unloading ware. All levels welcome; some wheel experience helpful.

class_name: Dog Yoga: Downward Dog with Your Dog
description: Bond with your pup through gentle yoga poses designed for canine companions and their humans. Build relaxation, flexibility, and trust together.

In a 4/4 compas (rhythm), practice flamenco moves, armwork, floor patterns and clapping to Spanish music. Learn about the dance's history and geography, and find your own expression. Class includes warm up and cool down.

Express the inner life of your toaster, washing machine, or vacuum cleaner through the power of dance! Explore themes of domesticity, consumerism, and the existential angst of the modern appliance. Bring your own appliance.

class_name: Flatpicking for Country and Bluegrass Guitar
description: Explore backup patterns, walks, solos and transposition in country and bluegrass guitar music. Some knowledge of chords expected. Bring a tuned guitar (any type), 2+ medium gauge picks, textbook and pencil.

Master the ancient art of yodeling for practical use in the modern city. Learn to project your voice across noisy streets, communicate with neighbors from afar, and express your inner mountain spirit in any environment.

Balance is an essential movement skill that we need throughout our lives. Mindful Movement develops foot agility, hip and leg strength, proprioception, and visual awareness, using a fun and accessible mix of Yoga and Qigong.

class_name: Existential Dread Management Through Interpretive Sock Puppetry
description: Confront the void and explore the meaninglessness of existence through the medium of sock puppets. Create your own existential puppet characters, write and perform short skits, and find catharsis in the absurd.

class_name: Coached Art Practice: Learn From Copying Your Favorites
description: Wish you could draw like Degas or use color like Monet? Through copying, absorb lessons from favorite artists and nourish your style. Instructor gives one-on-one guidance for choosing a reference, selecting materials and working through tough spots.
Craft compelling fictional worlds with detailed geography, believable societies, and rich histories. Ideal for writers looking to deepen their storytelling skills.

Let's welcome Spring with colorful hues. Create a quilt that will represent the happiness and joy of the season. Join new and experienced quilters alike and quilt together a bit of cheer. Students must bring a working sewing machine.

class_name: Laundry Room Zen: Mindfulness in Mundane Tasks
description: Transform your least favorite chores into relaxing rituals. Learn mindfulness techniques and meditations that elevate everyday laundry and ironing into moments of peace.

class_name: Sound in Science and the Arts
description: How does sound work in physical spaces and affect emotions? Via lectures and exercises in recording and sound processing, explore your interests in sonic arts in audio engineering, music composition, psychology, physics and more. All levels welcome.

class_name: Paranormal Podcasting: Ghost Hunting with Microphones
description: Learn how to create your own paranormal podcast! We'll cover ghost hunting basics, audio recording techniques, interviewing alleged witnesses, and building suspense through sound design.

Sing ballads in the Appalachian tradition, unaccompanied by instruments. Listen to songs and learn them line by line with lyrics sheets, without reading music. Dig into their history, practice singing together, and solo if you'd like.

class_name: Science of Sleep: Better Rest for Busy Lives
description: Discover proven techniques to improve sleep quality, manage insomnia, and enhance daytime energy. Explore sleep cycles, sleep hygiene, and quick relaxation exercises..

class_name: Exploring Classical Music: Baroque through 20th Century
description: Focus on musical styles and characteristics that define classical music and its major composers, from Baroque through 20th Century. Class includes lectures and discussions, as well as listening to recordings and watching performance videos.

class_name: Avant-Garde Taxidermy: Reimagining the Stuffed Animal
description: Go beyond traditional taxidermy and explore the artistic possibilities of animal preservation. Learn to create surreal, whimsical, and thought-provoking pieces using ethically sourced materials.

You've seen these unusual life forms growing on trees, rocks and even buildings. Learn about lichen biology, the role of lichens in their ecosystems and incredible lichens found in the Pacific Northwest.

class_name: Suburban Foraging: Identifying Edible Weeds and Questionable Mushrooms
description: Discover the hidden culinary treasures lurking in your backyard and beyond! Learn to identify (and tentatively taste) common edible weeds, questionably safe mushrooms, and other potentially palatable plants.

Explore the rhythmic realm of Indian percussion, from basic strokes to intricate compositions. Through instruction, playing, and feedback, start to cultivate precision, control, and improvisational skills. All levels of musicians welcome.

Join our ensemble and explore challenging and creative expression in a variety of musical stylings. All materials will be provided, along with custom arrangements designed to challenge and inspire. All levels welcome.

For movers who want to talk, and talkers who want to move. Through physical, vocal and verbal games, we tune in to the body's inherent connection with imagination, creating improvisations that are alive with truth and oddities of being.

Learn to use non-verbal communication, through mime, to engage your local representatives and express yourself in the face of adversity. Be ready to put on a show with your classmates in a public venue.

class_name: Histories of Drag Performance in Portland
description: Join Kevin Cook, aka the legendary Poison Waters, to explore six decades of local drag history. Politics, artistry, racial dynamics, the devastating effects of HIV, community-building and joy intertwine in these stories. All are welcome.
Dust off your roller skates and groove to classic disco hits! Learn smooth moves, choreographed routines, and safety tips for stylish skating.
Spring is coming and flowers are blooming. Through lecture, demonstration and your own work, explore uses of ink and brush in this art form.

Challenge the laws of physics and geometry through the art of origami! Learn to fold impossible shapes, create paper sculptures that defy logic, and explore the boundaries of reality through creasing and folding.

class_name: Ceramics All Levels: Focus on Surface Decoration
description: Develop wheel skills, as well as handbuilding. Learn a variety of surface decorating techniques, a different one each session. Bring tools if possible. Purchase clay via bookstore (online or in-person); pickup in studio. All levels welcome.

class_name: Upcycled Garden Gnomes: Giving Trash a New Life
description: Turn discarded plastic bottles, broken flowerpots, and other household waste into charming (or terrifying) garden gnomes! Learn basic sculpting, painting, and repurposing techniques.

Learn about and develop a practice for creating comics to explore memoir, reportage, history, biography, science, and/or other nonfiction illustrated narratives. Class includes sharing ideas and suggestions, as well as prompts for drawing.

class_name: Creative Hoaxes and Urban Legends in Storytelling
description: Examine famous hoaxes and urban legends to learn narrative techniques that captivate audiences. Design your own humorous or intriguing fictional tales.

class_name: Stained Glass Basics: Make a Mackintosh Rose Suncatcher
description: Learn the fundamentals of the stained glass process from start to finish as you construct a simple Mackintosh rose suncatcher. Your finished small work of art will measure 5 inches across.

class_name: Competitive Dog Grooming: Extreme Canine Makeovers
description: Transform your furry friend into a living work of art! Learn advanced dog grooming techniques, including creative coloring, sculpting, and accessorizing. Compete in themed grooming challenges and push the boundaries of canine couture. Dogs must be comfortable with extensive handling.

class_name: Next Steps for Fiction Writers: Agents and Marketing
description: Now that you've written your fiction book, what's next? Practice pitches so you are ready to talk with agents. Craft and workshop a synopsis, marketing plan and query letters. We work with each other to take our materials to the next level.

Help your furry, feathered, or scaled companion share their life story with the world! Learn to ghostwrite from your pet's perspective, choose the right publishing platform, and market your book to other animal lovers.

class_name: Memoir for Beginners: Where to Start, How to Keep Going
description: Everybody has a story to tell, but how do you tell it? We'll do generative writing prompts, outlining and brainstorming exercises and close reads of memoir openings and excerpts. We'll look for themes in others' work and our own.
Share your time-traveling experiences, frustrations, and insights into history and the future. This support group is designed to support each other through the difficulties of time travel.

Learn the basics of flower arranging including color, design, care and purchasing as it applies to designing wedding flowers. Test your creativity in designing a floral centerpiece, wedding bouquet, corsages and boutonnieres. Students will create and bring home all of their own designs.

class_name: Voice Liberation: Singing for Stress Relief
description: Discover singing as a tool for stress reduction. Learn vocal exercises, harmonizing techniques, and gentle breathing practices designed to relax the mind and body.

Learn about the geology of earthquakes and why the Pacific Northwest is at high risk in the future. Gain insight on how a major earthquake can impact our local communities. Understand what preventative and mitigative actions you can take to enhance your safety and survival prospects for your home and family.
When disaster strikes, and modern society is no more, what skills will be needed? Learn to make your own clothes using various natural resources.
The appeal of a classic soup is universal and welcome at any table. Learn to make Belgian beer cheese soup, Asian hot and sour soup and Zuppa Toscana tomato and basil soup.
Learn to maximize your time and resources through coupon mastery.

For some, overall health can be improved or enhanced by eating primarily a plant-based diet. Discover how being plant-forward can positively impact your health, longevity and quality of life. Learn more about plant-based nutrition, meal preparation, substitutions and more!

class_name: Fermenting Fears: Conquering Anxiety with Pickles
description: Explore the unexpected connection between gut health and mental well-being! Learn to ferment a variety of vegetables while discussing the science of probiotics, the gut-brain axis, and the potential for pickles to soothe your soul.

Experience the versatility and delicious food created by using outdoor wood-fired ovens. Learn to start the fire to cook savory old-world style pizza and focaccia, roast salmon and squash and dry herbs and fruit. Bring your appetite!

class_name: Urban Chicken Whispering: Backyard Poultry Psychology
description: Communicate with your chickens on a deeper level! Learn to interpret clucking patterns, understand pecking order dynamics, and build a trusting relationship with your backyard flock. Bonus: chicken hypnosis demonstration.
